description: From Spanish flamenco, from Middle Dutch vlaminc (“Fleming”) (> Dutch Vlaming).

entries.meaning: (uncountable) A genre of folk music and dance native to Andalusia, in Spain.
examples: It's impossible to tell the story of flamenco without talking about Lorca, who found in it a source of inspiration in a lifelong political-cultural-sexual struggle against bourgeois philistinism.

entries.meaning: (countable) A song or dance performed in such a style.
examples: La Niña was so goddam terrific that after a month of singing with the vocal trio, she was singing solo and she was dancing a flamenco better'n a gypsy fireball!

verbs.description: flamenco (third-person singular simple present flamencos, present participle flamencoing, simple past and past participle flamencoed)
